head.title: Industry, Not Sun, Is Culprit in Global Warming

hedline.hl1: Industry, Not Sun, Is Culprit in Global Warming

abstract.p: Arnold Henderson letter on Sept 21 article on rapid growth in car population (S)

block.p: The news that our car population is growing faster than our human population (news article, Sept. 21) carries environmental threats, including threats from the stuff we park all those cars on.

When we pave driveways with asphalt and other impermeable surfaces, storm water runs off instead of sinking in. Groundwater goes unreplenished, storm sewers overflow and rivers flood. It's time to switch to materials like permeable asphalt with its large pore structure, brick, paver blocks or crushed stone.
The news that our car population is growing faster than our human population (news article, Sept. 21) carries environmental threats, including threats from the stuff we park all those cars on.

When we pave driveways with asphalt and other impermeable surfaces, storm water runs off instead of sinking in. Groundwater goes unreplenished, storm sewers overflow and rivers flood. It's time to switch to materials like permeable asphalt with its large pore structure, brick, paver blocks or crushed stone.

Homeowners and mall owners have choices, and zoning boards can stop granting stores and malls parking lot coverage if they don't use permeable materials. Otherwise, the flood of cars becomes a real flood of swollen and polluted streams.
The writer is vice chairman, Highland Park Environmental Commission.
